decision_name: Fast-track tool acquisition & moratorium on shadow tool procurement

decision_name: Migrate all Data Science data storage off local machines into cloud environments
decision_description: To improve our data security, and make "hidden" compute loads visible, reconfigure all DS team members tool compute usage and data storage on to cloud-hosted platforms
decision_motivation: Cross-team collaboration | Data connectivity | Data security
steps: Data inventory for small DS subset | Conduct x 7 workflow interviews | Identify quick wins | Map technical constraints | Extend DS sample size if needed | Design target architecture (cloud environment(s) | Develop training materials and how-to's | Run pilot with c.10 DS | Go/No-go decision

decision_name: Implement a consumption-based tool recharge mechanism from Global D&A to regions
decision_description: To support future tool migration work, and to avoid blockers arising from Digital D&A budget limitations, agree a recharge mechanism with Finance and the regions so that analytics tool costs can be re-allocated in proportion to regions' usage. Re-use our existing FinOps processes and teams for this.
decision_motivation: Cost savings | Cross-team collaboration | Productivity increase
steps: Global application tagging schema & new appID process | Agree FY26 in-scope analytics tools & apps | Current process state documented | Define showback model (cost types & metrics) | Reporting units confirmed (teams, regions, products, projects) | Close data (automated) source gaps | Future process state designed & implemented | RACI Agreed across TS, Digital & Finance | First showback report across tool scope | Future iterations

decision_motivation: Cost savings | Cross-team collaboration | Data connectivity | Data security | Fewer tool integrations | New analytics capabilities |  Productivity increase | Resilience | User experience

decision_name: Select & procure a designated graph database product for Brambles
decision_description: There is good evidence that specialist graph databases could bring benefits to D&A across Brambles. For example in these use cases: entity resolution, data lineage and provenance, master data management, network & route optimisation, predicted time of arrival etc.

Learning needs assessment conducted by Databricks & customised training plan designed.
decision_motivation: Cross-team collaboration | Data connectivity | Data security | Fewer tool integrations | New analytics capabilities |  Productivity increase | Resilience | User experience

decision_name: Designate A2A & MCP as the default protocols for agentic AI across Brambles
decision_description: Immediate adoption of two complementary open standards: Agent-to-Agent Protocol (A2A) and Model Context Protocol (MCP) as our enterprise foundation for agent-agent and agent-tool interworking. The alternative, fragmented proprietary solutions or no standards, risks creating expensive technical debt, vendor lock-in, and inability to participate in the emerging AI agent ecosystem.
decision_motivation: Data connectivity | New analytics capabilities | User experience
